newsitem.title: USA: US copper refinery shipments rise in October -ABMS.
newsitem.headline: US copper refinery shipments rise in October -ABMS.

text.p: Shipments of copper cathode by refineries in the United States rose to 208,800 short tons in October 1996, up from 184,500 short tons in September, the American Bureau of Metal Statistics reported.
Imports from non-U.S. refiners in October were 38,000 tons, down from 56,500 tons in September.
ABMS has altered the way it gathers global copper data which has led to major revisions.
Refined cathode production in the U.S. in October was 223,100 short tons, up from 196,900 tons in September.
Inventory at the end of October at U.S. refineries totaled 13,000 tons, down from 14,100 tons in September.
Inventory at refineries outside the U.S. in October were 161,700 tons, barely changed from September's 161,800 tons.
